publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-272# Karen Whitefield: Credit Union—That the Parliament recognises the benefits brought to many communities such as Airdrie and Shotts by credit unions including access to low cost credit to families who would otherwise have to borrow from high interest loan sharks, encouraging a saving ethos and empowering communities to address their own problems, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to bring forward measures to establish and implement a credit union development strategy for Scotland that will ensure a consistent level of support throughout Scotland.

S1M-272# Karen Whitefield: Credit Union-That the Parliament recognises the benefits brought to many communities such as Airdrie and Shotts by credit unions including access to low cost credit to families who would otherwise have to borrow from high interest loan sharks, encouraging a saving ethos and empowering communities to address their own problems, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to bring forward measures to establish and implement a credit union development strategy for Scotland that will ensure a consistent level of support throughout Scotland. Supported by: Michael Russell*, Rhoda Grant*
S1M-272# Credit Union (lodged on 11 November 1999) Malcolm Chisholm*
S1M-272# Credit Union (lodged on 11 November 1999) Scott Barrie*, Ms Margaret Curran*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Mr John McAllion*, Alex Neil*
S1M-272# Credit Union (lodged on 11 November 1999) Mr Andy Kerr*R, Andrew Wilson*
S1M-272# Credit Union (lodged on 11 November 1999) Elaine Smith*, Robert Brown*, Mr Michael McMahon*, Donald Gorrie*, Johann Lamont*

S1M-272# Karen Whitefield: Credit Union—That the Parliament recognises the benefits brought to many communities such as Airdrie and Shotts by credit unions including access to low cost credit to families who would otherwise have to borrow from high interest loan sharks, encouraging a saving ethos and empowering communities to address their own problems, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to bring forward measures to establish and implement a credit union development strategy for Scotland that will ensure a consistent level of support throughout Scotland. Supported by: Michael Russell, Rhoda Grant, Malcolm Chisholm, Scott Barrie, Ms Margaret Curran, Dr Elaine Murray, Mr John McAllion, Alex Neil, Mr Andy Kerr R, Elaine Smith, Robert Brown, Mr Michael McMahon, Donald Gorrie, Johann Lamont, Tommy Sheridan*

Supported by: Michael Russell, Rhoda Grant, Malcolm Chisholm, Scott Barrie, Ms Margaret Curran, Dr Elaine Murray, Mr John McAllion, Alex Neil, Mr Andy Kerr R, Elaine Smith, Robert Brown, Mr Michael McMahon, Donald Gorrie, Johann Lamont, Tommy Sheridan, Fergus Ewing, Margaret Jamieson, Trish Godman, Cathie Craigie, Patricia Ferguson, Cathy Jamieson, Cathy Peattie*
